p: Rodents play an important role in the epidemiology of disease emergence/re-emergence. They are capable of transmitting a large number of zoonotic disease agents either directly such as leptospirosis, Sin Nombre virus and Hantaan virus which spread via dust contaminated with dried rodent urine (Hansen et al. 2015) (Pijnacker et al. 2016) or indirectly as plague (Yersinia pestis). The global warming influences the change in rodent distribution maps and their population worldwide (Moore et al. 2011).
